Question_1.Context: In organic chemistry, biostimulants are substances or microorganisms applied to plants with the aim to enhance nutrition efficiency, abiotic stress tolerance, and/or crop quality traits, regardless of its nutrient content.
Question_1.Question: What is the primary function of biostimulants in agriculture?
Question_1.B: To enhance plant growth and nutrition efficiency
Question_1.Source: Biostimulants promoting growth of Vicia faba L. seedlings: inulin coated ZnO nanoparticles.

Question_2.Context: Nanoparticles are increasingly being explored in agriculture to improve plant growth and productivity. Zinc oxide (ZnO) nanoparticles, in particular, have been studied for their potential as a micronutrient source in plant nutrition.
Question_2.Question: What is the role of Zinc oxide (ZnO) nanoparticles in plant nutrition?
Question_2.A: They act as a macronutrient source
Question_2.B: They are used to increase soil pH
Question_2.C: They serve as a micronutrient source

Question_3.Context: Inulin is a type of polysaccharide that is found in many plants. It is often used in agriculture as a coating agent for other substances to improve their stability and interaction with plants.
Question_3.Question: What is the purpose of using inulin as a coating agent for nanoparticles in agriculture?
Question_3.A: To increase the toxicity of nanoparticles
Question_3.B: To improve the interaction of nanoparticles with plants
Question_3.D: To decrease the solubility of nanoparticles

Question_4.Context: Vicia faba L., commonly known as the broad bean, fava bean, or faba bean, is a species of flowering plant in the pea and bean family Fabaceae. It is of significant agricultural value as a food crop.
Question_4.Question: What family does the plant species Vicia faba L. belong to?
Question_4.Source: Biostimulants promoting growth of Vicia faba L. seedlings.

Question_5.Context: The application of nanoparticles in agriculture is a subject of research due to their potential to enhance plant growth and protect against pests and diseases.
Question_5.Question: What is one potential application of nanoparticles in agriculture?
Question_5.Source: Biostimulants promoting growth of Vicia faba L. seedlings.

Question_6.Context: Zinc is an essential micronutrient for plant growth, playing a significant role in various physiological processes.
Question_6.Question: Why is zinc considered an essential micronutrient for plants?
Question_6.A: It is a primary energy source
Question_6.B: It is a major component of chlorophyll
Question_6.C: It plays a role in various physiological processes
Question_6.D: It is the main component of plant cell walls

Question_7.Context: The solubility of substances is an important factor in agriculture, as it affects the availability of nutrients and other compounds to plants.
Question_7.Question: Why is the solubility of a substance important in agricultural applications?
Question_7.B: It affects the taste of the crops
Question_7.C: It affects the availability of the substance to plants

Question_8.Context: Polysaccharides are a type of carbohydrate that can be used in agriculture to improve the delivery and efficacy of other agricultural inputs.
Question_8.Question: What is a common use of polysaccharides in agriculture?
Question_8.B: To improve the delivery of other agricultural inputs

Question_9.Context: Micronutrients, although required in smaller quantities than macronutrients, are crucial for plant health and development.
Question_9.Question: Why are micronutrients important for plants?
Question_9.A: They provide the main source of calories for plants
Question_9.B: They are the only nutrients plants need
Question_9.C: They are crucial for plant health and development
Question_9.D: They make plants resistant to all diseases

Question_10.Context: The interaction between nanoparticles and plants can be influenced by the surface properties of the nanoparticles, which can be modified by coatings such as polysaccharides.
Question_10.Question: How can the interaction between nanoparticles and plants be influenced?
Question_10.A: By the color of the nanoparticles
Question_10.B: By the surface properties of the nanoparticles
Question_10.C: By the size of the plants
Question_10.D: By the aroma of the nanoparticles
